Forest plot The split.screen function is used to split a plotting window into different rectangular sections called “screens”. Then use the forest command to draw the forest plot. Figure 3.1 is the forest plot of Nishiumra data. split.screen(c(1,2)) screen(1) forest(madad.nishimura, type = "sens", xlab = "Sensitivity", cex = .8, snames = nishimura$study_id) screen(2) forest(madad.nishimura, type = "spec", xlab = "Specificity", cex = .8, snames = nishimura$study_id) close.screen(all.screens = T) Figure 3.1: The forest plot of Nishiumra data. 1c.
